channel.title: Getting no-ip to work with a router
channel.description: i look and observed other people making servers, read tuts for about a week, didint ask questions but 1 or 2, and now i have a decent server up and running. BUT IT REQUIRES HAMACHI! and this is annoying because not all people have hamachi, so i wanted to get a no-ip. so you say *no-ip would be my answer to this* right? well i cant get no-ip to work. i halfway know the problem. ok i am behind a router. i removed the router for 10 min and asked my friend to try the ip adress now. it worked. but when i have toe router connected, it doesnt work *and my moms bf says i need to keep the router up* so he can get on *dur*. i fowarded the ports on my router settings, and on my firewall. i even completely disabled my firewall in hopes of getting my no-ip to work. but still no hopw. anyone know the problem? if so can you please give me some advise? thanks.

item.title: Getting no-ip to work with a router
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath.v2 Aftermath.v2
item.description:
@Aftermath.v2 wrote:

Make sure you forwarded the port to the right computer.

It’s useless forwarding a port to a computer without a server.

i look and observed other people making servers, read tuts for about a week, didint ask questions but 1 or 2, and now i have a decent server up and running. BUT IT REQUIRES HAMACHI! and this is annoying because not all people have hamachi, so i wanted to get a no-ip. so you say *no-ip would be my answer to this* right? well i cant get no-ip to work. i halfway know the problem. ok i am behind a router. i removed the router for 10 min and asked my friend to try the ip adress now. it worked. but when i have toe router connected, it doesnt work *and my moms bf says i need to keep the router up* so he can get on *dur*. [b]i fowarded the ports [/b]on my router settings, and on my firewall. i even completely disabled my firewall in hopes of getting my no-ip to work. but still no hopw. anyone know the problem? if so can you please give me some advise? thanks.
